page.title: 01GENERAL INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area covered by our Domesday Block lies to the north of Manchester.It contains the border between two neighbouring counties,Lancashire and Greater Manchester. The bottom edge of our block contains part of the town of{Ramsbottom},while to the north are the villages of{ {Stubbins}and{Edenfield},with the two small hamlets of{Chatterton}and{ {Strongstry}. Over half the area consists of open moorland,partly rough grazing and partly intensively farmed grassland. The River Irwell flows through our block,from north to south,and through its valley runs the area's major road,the M66,which in its northern section becomes the Edenfield By-Pass.
